     460             : 
     461             : /**
     462             :  * An indirect observer object that means we don't have to implement nsIObserver
     463             :  * on nsGlobalWindow, where any script could see it.
     464             :  */
     465             : class nsGlobalWindowObserver final : public nsIObserver,
     466             :                                      public nsIInterfaceRequestor
     467             : {
     468             : public:
     469           0 :   explicit nsGlobalWindowObserver(nsGlobalWindow* aWindow) : mWindow(aWindow) {}
     470             :   NS_DECL_ISUPPORTS
     471           0 :   NS_IMETHOD Observe(nsISupports* aSubject, const char* aTopic, const char16_t* aData) override
     472             :   {
     473           0 :     if (!mWindow)
     474             :       return NS_OK;
     475           0 :     return mWindow->Observe(aSubject, aTopic, aData);
     476             :   }
     477           0 :   void Forget() { mWindow = nullptr; }
     478           0 :   NS_IMETHOD GetInterface(const nsIID& aIID, void** aResult) override
     479             :   {
     480           0 :     if (mWindow && aIID.Equals(NS_GET_IID(nsIDOMWindow)) && mWindow) {
     481           0 :       return mWindow->QueryInterface(aIID, aResult);
     482             :     }
     483             :     return NS_NOINTERFACE;
     484             :   }
     485             : 
     486             : private:
     487             :   ~nsGlobalWindowObserver() = default;
     488             : 
     489             :   // This reference is non-owning and safe because it's cleared by
     490             :   // nsGlobalWindow::CleanUp().
     491             :   nsGlobalWindow* MOZ_NON_OWNING_REF mWindow;
     492             : };
     493             :

     561             : class IdleRequestExecutor final : public nsIRunnable
     562             :                                 , public nsICancelableRunnable
     563             :                                 , public nsIIncrementalRunnable
     564             : {
     565             : public:
     566           0 :   explicit IdleRequestExecutor(nsGlobalWindow* aWindow)
     567             :     : mDispatched(false)
     568             :     , mDeadline(TimeStamp::Now())
     569           0 :     , mWindow(aWindow)
     570             :   {
     571           0 :     MOZ_DIAGNOSTIC_ASSERT(mWindow);
     572           0 :     MOZ_DIAGNOSTIC_ASSERT(mWindow->IsInnerWindow());
     573             : 
     574           0 :     mIdlePeriodLimit = { mDeadline, mWindow->LastIdleRequestHandle() };
     575           0 :     mDelayedExecutorDispatcher = new IdleRequestExecutorTimeoutHandler(this);
     576           0 :   }
     577             : 
     578             :   NS_DECL_CYCLE_COLLECTING_ISUPPORTS
     579           0 :   NS_DECL_CYCLE_COLLECTION_CLASS_AMBIGUOUS(IdleRequestExecutor, nsIRunnable)
     580             : 
     581             :   NS_DECL_NSIRUNNABLE
     582             :   nsresult Cancel() override;
     583             :   void SetDeadline(TimeStamp aDeadline) override;
     584             : 
     585           0 :   bool IsCancelled() const { return !mWindow || mWindow->AsInner()->InnerObjectsFreed(); }
     586             :   // Checks if aRequest shouldn't execute in the current idle period
     587             :   // since it has been queued from a chained call to
     588             :   // requestIdleCallback from within a running idle callback.
     589           0 :   bool IneligibleForCurrentIdlePeriod(IdleRequest* aRequest) const
     590             :   {
     591           0 :     return aRequest->Handle() >= mIdlePeriodLimit.mLastRequestIdInIdlePeriod &&
     592           0 :            TimeStamp::Now() <= mIdlePeriodLimit.mEndOfIdlePeriod;
     593             :   }
     594             : 
     595             :   void MaybeUpdateIdlePeriodLimit();
     596             : 
     597             :   // Maybe dispatch the IdleRequestExecutor. MabyeDispatch will
     598             :   // schedule a delayed dispatch if the associated window is in the
     599             :   // background or if given a time to wait until dispatching.
     600             :   void MaybeDispatch(TimeStamp aDelayUntil = TimeStamp());
     601             :   void ScheduleDispatch();
     602             : private:
     603           0 :   struct IdlePeriodLimit
     604             :   {
     605             :     TimeStamp mEndOfIdlePeriod;
     606             :     uint32_t mLastRequestIdInIdlePeriod;
     607             :   };
     608             : 
     609             :   void DelayedDispatch(uint32_t aDelay);
     610             : 
     611           0 :   ~IdleRequestExecutor() {}
     612             : 
     613             :   bool mDispatched;
     614             :   TimeStamp mDeadline;
     615             :   IdlePeriodLimit mIdlePeriodLimit;
     616             :   RefPtr<nsGlobalWindow> mWindow;
     617             :   // The timeout handler responsible for dispatching this executor in
     618             :   // the case of immediate dispatch to the idle queue isn't
     619             :   // desirable. This is used if we've dispatched all idle callbacks
     620             :   // that are allowed to run in the current idle period, or if the
     621             :   // associated window is currently in the background.
     622             :   nsCOMPtr<nsITimeoutHandler> mDelayedExecutorDispatcher;
     623             :   // If not Nothing() then this value is the handle to the currently
     624             :   // scheduled delayed executor dispatcher. This is needed to be able
     625             :   // to cancel the timeout handler in case of the executor being
     626             :   // cancelled.
     627             :   Maybe<int32_t> mDelayedExecutorHandle;
     628             : };
     629             : 
     630             : NS_IMPL_CYCLE_COLLECTION_CLASS(IdleRequestExecutor)
     631             :

     670           0 :   if (mDelayedExecutorHandle && mWindow) {
     671           0 :     mWindow->AsInner()->TimeoutManager().ClearTimeout(
     672             :       mDelayedExecutorHandle.value(),
     673           0 :       Timeout::Reason::eIdleCallbackTimeout);
     674             :   }
     675             : 
     676           0 :   mWindow = nullptr;
     677           0 :   return NS_OK;
     678             : }

     700             : void
     701           0 : IdleRequestExecutor::MaybeDispatch(TimeStamp aDelayUntil)
     702             : {
     703             :   // If we've already dispatched the executor we don't want to do it
     704             :   // again. Also, if we've called IdleRequestExecutor::Cancel mWindow
     705             :   // will be null, which indicates that we shouldn't dispatch this
     706             :   // executor either.
     707           0 :   if (mDispatched || IsCancelled()) {
     708           0 :     return;
     709             :   }
     710             : 
     711           0 :   mDispatched = true;
     712             : 
     713           0 :   nsPIDOMWindowOuter* outer = mWindow->GetOuterWindow();
     714           0 :   if (outer && outer->AsOuter()->IsBackground()) {
     715             :     // Set a timeout handler with a timeout of 0 ms to throttle idle
     716             :     // callback requests coming from a backround window using
     717             :     // background timeout throttling.
     718           0 :     DelayedDispatch(0);
     719           0 :     return;
     720             :   }
     721             : 
     722           0 :   TimeStamp now = TimeStamp::Now();
     723           0 :   if (!aDelayUntil || aDelayUntil < now) {
     724           0 :     ScheduleDispatch();
     725           0 :     return;
     726             :   }
     727             : 
     728           0 :   TimeDuration delay = aDelayUntil - now;
     729           0 :   DelayedDispatch(static_cast<uint32_t>(delay.ToMilliseconds()));

     830             :     // There are no more idle requests, so stop scheduling idle

    1266             : bool
    1267           0 : nsOuterWindowProxy::getPrototypeIfOrdinary(JSContext* cx,
    1268             :                                            JS::Handle<JSObject*> proxy,
    1269             :                                            bool* isOrdinary,
    1270             :                                            JS::MutableHandle<JSObject*> protop) const
    1271             : {
    1272             :   // Window's [[GetPrototypeOf]] trap isn't the ordinary definition:
    1273             :   //
    1274             :   //   https://html.spec.whatwg.org/multipage/browsers.html#windowproxy-getprototypeof
    1275             :   //
    1276             :   // We nonetheless can implement it with a static [[Prototype]], because
    1277             :   // wrapper-class handlers (particularly, XOW in FilteringWrapper.cpp) supply
    1278             :   // all non-ordinary behavior.
    1279             :   //
    1280             :   // But from a spec point of view, it's the exact same object in both cases --
    1281             :   // only the observer's changed.  So this getPrototypeIfOrdinary trap on the
    1282             :   // non-wrapper object *must* report non-ordinary, even if static [[Prototype]]
    1283             :   // usually means ordinary.
    1284           0 :   *isOrdinary = false;
    1285           0 :   return true;
    1286             : }
    1287             : 
    1288             : bool
    1289           0 : nsOuterWindowProxy::preventExtensions(JSContext* cx,
    1290             :                                       JS::Handle<JSObject*> proxy,
    1291             :                                       JS::ObjectOpResult& result) const
    1292             : {
    1293             :   // If [[Extensible]] could be false, then navigating a window could navigate
    1294             :   // to a window that's [[Extensible]] after being at one that wasn't: an
    1295             :   // invariant violation.  So never change a window's extensibility.
    1296           0 :   return result.failCantPreventExtensions();
    1297             : }
    1298             :

    2131             : // QueryInterface implementation for nsGlobalWindow
    2132           0 : NS_INTERFACE_MAP_BEGIN_CYCLE_COLLECTION(nsGlobalWindow)

    2479             : bool
    2480           0 : nsGlobalWindow::WouldReuseInnerWindow(nsIDocument* aNewDocument)
    2481             : {
    2482             :   MOZ_ASSERT(IsOuterWindow());
    2483             : 
    2484             :   // We reuse the inner window when:
    2485             :   // a. We are currently at our original document.
    2486             :   // b. At least one of the following conditions are true:
    2487             :   // -- The new document is the same as the old document. This means that we're
    2488             :   //    getting called from document.open().
    2489             :   // -- The new document has the same origin as what we have loaded right now.
    2490             : 
    2491           0 :   if (!mDoc || !aNewDocument) {
    2492             :     return false;
    2493             :   }
    2494             : 
    2495           0 :   if (!mDoc->IsInitialDocument()) {
    2496             :     return false;
    2497             :   }
    2498             : 
    2499             : #ifdef DEBUG
    2500             : {
    2501             :   nsCOMPtr<nsIURI> uri;
    2502             :   mDoc->GetDocumentURI()->CloneIgnoringRef(getter_AddRefs(uri));
    2503             :   NS_ASSERTION(NS_IsAboutBlank(uri), "How'd this happen?");
    2504             : }
    2505             : #endif
    2506             : 
    2507             :   // Great, we're the original document, check for one of the other
    2508             :   // conditions.
    2509             : 
    2510           0 :   if (mDoc == aNewDocument) {
    2511             :     return true;
    2512             :   }
    2513             : 
    2514             :   bool equal;
    2515           0 :   if (NS_SUCCEEDED(mDoc->NodePrincipal()->Equals(aNewDocument->NodePrincipal(),
    2516           0 :                                                  &equal)) &&
    2517             :       equal) {
    2518             :     // The origin is the same.
    2519             :     return true;
    2520             :   }
    2521             : 
    2522           0 :   return false;
    2523             : }
    2524             : 
    2525             : void
    2526           0 : nsGlobalWindow::SetInitialPrincipalToSubject()
    2527             : {
    2528             :   MOZ_ASSERT(IsOuterWindow());
    2529             : 
    2530             :   // First, grab the subject principal.
    2531           0 :   nsCOMPtr<nsIPrincipal> newWindowPrincipal = nsContentUtils::SubjectPrincipalOrSystemIfNativeCaller();
    2532             : 
    2533             :   // We should never create windows with an expanded principal.
    2534             :   // If we have a system principal, make sure we're not using it for a content
    2535             :   // docshell.
    2536             :   // NOTE: Please keep this logic in sync with nsWebShellWindow::Initialize().
    2537           0 :   if (nsContentUtils::IsExpandedPrincipal(newWindowPrincipal) ||
    2538           0 :       (nsContentUtils::IsSystemPrincipal(newWindowPrincipal) &&
    2539           0 :        GetDocShell()->ItemType() != nsIDocShellTreeItem::typeChrome)) {
    2540           0 :     newWindowPrincipal = nullptr;
    2541             :   }
    2542             : 
    2543             :   // If there's an existing document, bail if it either:
    2544           0 :   if (mDoc) {
    2545             :     // (a) is not an initial about:blank document, or
    2546           0 :     if (!mDoc->IsInitialDocument())
    2547             :       return;
    2548             :     // (b) already has the correct principal.
    2549           0 :     if (mDoc->NodePrincipal() == newWindowPrincipal)
    2550             :       return;
    2551             : 
    2552             : #ifdef DEBUG
    2553             :     // If we have a document loaded at this point, it had better be about:blank.
    2554             :     // Otherwise, something is really weird. An about:blank page has a
    2555             :     // NullPrincipal.
    2556             :     bool isNullPrincipal;
    2557             :     MOZ_ASSERT(NS_SUCCEEDED(mDoc->NodePrincipal()->GetIsNullPrincipal(&isNullPrincipal)) &&
    2558             :                isNullPrincipal);
    2559             : #endif
    2560             :   }
    2561             : 
    2562           0 :   GetDocShell()->CreateAboutBlankContentViewer(newWindowPrincipal);
    2563           0 :   mDoc->SetIsInitialDocument(true);
    2564             : 
    2565           0 :   nsCOMPtr<nsIPresShell> shell = GetDocShell()->GetPresShell();
    2566             : 
    2567           0 :   if (shell && !shell->DidInitialize()) {
    2568             :     // Ensure that if someone plays with this document they will get
    2569             :     // layout happening.
    2570           0 :     nsRect r = shell->GetPresContext()->GetVisibleArea();
    2571           0 :     shell->Initialize(r.width, r.height);
    2572             :   }
    2573             : }

    2708           0 :   NS_ENSURE_TRUE(obj, false);
    2709             : 
    2710             :   // We hide enablePrivilege behind a pref because it has been altered in a
    2711             :   // way that makes it fundamentally insecure to use in production. Mozilla
    2712             :   // uses this pref during automated testing to support legacy test code that
    2713             :   // uses enablePrivilege. If you're not doing test automation, you _must_ not
    2714             :   // flip this pref, or you will be exposing all your users to security
    2715             :   // vulnerabilities.
    2716           0 :   if (!xpc::IsInAutomation()) {
    2717             :     return true;

    2745             :     // There may be a small chance that parentOuterWin has navigated in
    2746             :     // the time that it took us to start loading this sub-document.  If that
    2747             :     // were the case then parentOuterWin->GetCurrentInnerWindow() wouldn't

    2751             :     // document that we know is embedding us.

    3059             :       // and proto, which makes the JS engine look up classes in

    3462           0 : nsGlobalWindow::DetachFromDocShell()

    3466             :   // DetachFromDocShell means the window is being torn down. Drop our
    3467             :   // reference to the script context, allowing it to be deleted
    3468             :   // later. Meanwhile, keep our weak reference to the script object

    3956           0 : nsGlobalWindow::SetArguments(nsIArray *aArguments)
    3957             : {
    3958             :   MOZ_ASSERT(IsOuterWindow());
    3959             :   nsresult rv;
    3960             : 
    3961             :   // Historically, we've used the same machinery to handle openDialog arguments
    3962             :   // (exposed via window.arguments) and showModalDialog arguments (exposed via
    3963             :   // window.dialogArguments), even though the former is XUL-only and uses an XPCOM
    3964             :   // array while the latter is web-exposed and uses an arbitrary JS value.
    3965             :   // Moreover, per-spec |dialogArguments| is a property of the browsing context
    3966             :   // (outer), whereas |arguments| lives on the inner.
    3967             :   //
    3968             :   // We've now mostly separated them, but the difference is still opaque to
    3969             :   // nsWindowWatcher (the caller of SetArguments in this little back-and-forth
    3970             :   // embedding waltz we do here).
    3971             :   //
    3972             :   // So we need to demultiplex the two cases here.
    3973           0 :   nsGlobalWindow *currentInner = GetCurrentInnerWindowInternal();
    3974           0 :   if (mIsModalContentWindow) {
    3975             :     // nsWindowWatcher blindly converts the original nsISupports into an array
    3976             :     // of length 1. We need to recover it, and then cast it back to the concrete
    3977             :     // object we know it to be.
    3978           0 :     nsCOMPtr<nsISupports> supports = do_QueryElementAt(aArguments, 0, &rv);
    3979           0 :     NS_ENSURE_SUCCESS(rv, rv);
    3980           0 :     mDialogArguments = static_cast<DialogValueHolder*>(supports.get());
    3981             :   } else {
    3982           0 :     mArguments = aArguments;
    3983           0 :     rv = currentInner->DefineArgumentsProperty(aArguments);
    3984           0 :     NS_ENSURE_SUCCESS(rv, rv);
    3985             :   }
    3986             : 
    3987             :   return NS_OK;
    3988             : }
    3989             :

    4611             : /**
    4612             :  * GetScriptableParent is called when script reads window.parent.
    4613             :  *
    4614             :  * In contrast to GetRealParent, GetScriptableParent respects <iframe
    4615             :  * mozbrowser> boundaries, so if |this| is contained by an <iframe
    4616             :  * mozbrowser>, we will return |this| as its own parent.
    4617             :  */
    4618             : nsPIDOMWindowOuter*

    4626             :

    4629             :  * if GetScriptableParent would return this window.
    4630             :  */
    4631             : nsPIDOMWindowOuter*

    4635             : 
    4636           0 :   nsPIDOMWindowOuter* parent = GetScriptableParent();
    4637           0 :   return (Cast(parent) == this) ? nullptr : parent;
    4638             : }
    4639             :

    4665             : static nsresult
    4666           0 : GetTopImpl(nsGlobalWindow* aWin, nsPIDOMWindowOuter** aTop, bool aScriptable)
    4667             : {
    4668           0 :   *aTop = nullptr;
    4669             : 
    4670             :   // Walk up the parent chain.
    4671             : 
    4672           0 :   nsCOMPtr<nsPIDOMWindowOuter> prevParent = aWin->AsOuter();
    4673           0 :   nsCOMPtr<nsPIDOMWindowOuter> parent = aWin->AsOuter();
    4674           0 :   do {
    4675           0 :     if (!parent) {
    4676             :       break;
    4677             :     }
    4678             : 
    4679           0 :     prevParent = parent;
    4680             : 
    4681             :     nsCOMPtr<nsPIDOMWindowOuter> newParent;
    4682           0 :     if (aScriptable) {
    4683           0 :       newParent = parent->GetScriptableParent();
    4684             :     }
    4685             :     else {
    4686           0 :       newParent = parent->GetParent();
    4687             :     }

    5229           0 : nsGlobalWindow::GetSanitizedOpener(nsPIDOMWindowOuter* aOpener)
    5230             : {
    5231           0 :   if (!aOpener) {
    5232             :     return nullptr;
    5233             :   }
    5234             : 
    5235           0 :   nsGlobalWindow* win = nsGlobalWindow::Cast(aOpener);
    5236             : 
    5237             :   // First, ensure that we're not handing back a chrome window to content:
    5238           0 :   if (win->IsChromeWindow()) {
    5239             :     return nullptr;
    5240             :   }
    5241             : 
    5242             :   // We don't want to reveal the opener if the opener is a mail window,
    5243             :   // because opener can be used to spoof the contents of a message (bug 105050).
    5244             :   // So, we look in the opener's root docshell to see if it's a mail window.
    5245           0 :   nsCOMPtr<nsIDocShell> openerDocShell = aOpener->GetDocShell();
    5246             :

    5322             :   // aOpener is not null, just define aOpener on our inner window's JS object,
    5323             :   // wrapped into the current compartment so that for Xrays we define on the
    5324             :   // Xray expando object, but don't set it on the outer window, so that it'll
    5325             :   // get reset on navigation.  This is just like replaceable properties, but
    5326             :   // we're not quite readonly.
    5327           0 :   if (!aOpener.isNull() && !nsContentUtils::IsCallerChrome()) {
    5328           0 :     RedefineProperty(aCx, "opener", aOpener, aError);

    5905             : CSSIntPoint
    5906           0 : nsGlobalWindow::GetScreenXY(CallerType aCallerType, ErrorResult& aError)
    5907             : {
    5908             :   MOZ_ASSERT(IsOuterWindow());
    5909             : 
    5910             :   // When resisting fingerprinting, always return (0,0)
    5911           0 :   if (nsContentUtils::ResistFingerprinting(aCallerType)) {
    5912           0 :     return CSSIntPoint(0, 0);
    5913             :   }
    5914             : 
    5915           0 :   nsCOMPtr<nsIBaseWindow> treeOwnerAsWin = GetTreeOwnerWindow();
    5916           0 :   if (!treeOwnerAsWin) {
    5917           0 :     aError.Throw(NS_ERROR_FAILURE);
    5918           0 :     return CSSIntPoint(0, 0);
    5919             :   }
    5920             : 
    5921           0 :   int32_t x = 0, y = 0;
    5922           0 :   aError = treeOwnerAsWin->GetPosition(&x, &y); // LayoutDevice px values
    5923             : 
    5924           0 :   RefPtr<nsPresContext> presContext;
    5925           0 :   mDocShell->GetPresContext(getter_AddRefs(presContext));
    5926           0 :   if (!presContext) {
    5927           0 :     return CSSIntPoint(x, y);
    5928             :   }
    5929             : 
    5930             :   // Find the global desktop coordinate of the top-left of the screen.
    5931             :   // We'll use this as a "fake origin" when converting to CSS px units,
    5932             :   // to avoid overlapping coordinates in cases such as a hi-dpi screen
    5933             :   // placed to the right of a lo-dpi screen on Windows. (Instead, there
    5934             :   // may be "gaps" in the resulting CSS px coordinates in some cases.)
    5935           0 :   nsDeviceContext *dc = presContext->DeviceContext();
    5936             :   nsRect screenRect;
    5937           0 :   dc->GetRect(screenRect);
    5938             :   LayoutDeviceRect screenRectDev =
    5939           0 :     LayoutDevicePixel::FromAppUnits(screenRect, dc->AppUnitsPerDevPixel());
    5940             : 
    5941           0 :   DesktopToLayoutDeviceScale scale = dc->GetDesktopToDeviceScale();
    5942           0 :   DesktopRect screenRectDesk = screenRectDev / scale;
    5943             : 
    5944             :   CSSPoint cssPt =
    5945             :     LayoutDevicePoint(x - screenRectDev.x, y - screenRectDev.y) /
    5946           0 :     presContext->CSSToDevPixelScale();
    5947           0 :   cssPt.x += screenRectDesk.x;
    5948           0 :   cssPt.y += screenRectDesk.y;
    5949             : 
    5950           0 :   return CSSIntPoint(NSToIntRound(cssPt.x), NSToIntRound(cssPt.y));
    5951             : }
    5952             :

    6270             : // NOTE: Arguments to this function should have values scaled to
    6271             : // CSS pixels, not device pixels.
    6272             : void
    6273           0 : nsGlobalWindow::CheckSecurityWidthAndHeight(int32_t* aWidth, int32_t* aHeight,
    6274             :                                             CallerType aCallerType)
    6275             : {
    6276             :   MOZ_ASSERT(IsOuterWindow());
    6277             : 
    6278             : #ifdef MOZ_XUL
    6279           0 :   if (aCallerType != CallerType::System) {
    6280             :     // if attempting to resize the window, hide any open popups
    6281           0 :     nsContentUtils::HidePopupsInDocument(mDoc);
    6282             :   }
    6283             : #endif
    6284             : 
    6285             :   // This one is easy. Just ensure the variable is greater than 100;
    6286           0 :   if ((aWidth && *aWidth < 100) || (aHeight && *aHeight < 100)) {
    6287             :     // Check security state for use in determing window dimensions
    6288             : 
    6289           0 :     if (aCallerType != CallerType::System) {
    6290             :       //sec check failed
    6291           0 :       if (aWidth && *aWidth < 100) {
    6292           0 :         *aWidth = 100;
    6293             :       }
    6294           0 :       if (aHeight && *aHeight < 100) {
    6295           0 :         *aHeight = 100;
    6296             :       }
    6297             :     }
    6298             :   }
    6299           0 : }
    6300             : 
    6301             : // NOTE: Arguments to this function should have values in device pixels

    6706             : static void
    6707           0 : FinishDOMFullscreenChange(nsIDocument* aDoc, bool aInDOMFullscreen)
    6708             : {
    6709           0 :   if (aInDOMFullscreen) {

    6712             :       // If we don't end up having anything in fullscreen,
    6713             :       // async request exiting fullscreen.
    6714           0 :       nsIDocument::AsyncExitFullscreen(aDoc);
    6715             :     }
    6716             :   } else {
    6717             :     // If the window is leaving fullscreen state, also ask the document
    6718             :     // to exit from DOM Fullscreen.
    6719           0 :     nsIDocument::ExitFullscreenInDocTree(aDoc);
    6720             :   }
    6721           0 : }
    6722             : 
    6723             : struct FullscreenTransitionDuration
    6724             : {
    6725             :   // The unit of the durations is millisecond
    6726             :   uint16_t mFadeIn = 0;
    6727             :   uint16_t mFadeOut = 0;
    6728           0 :   bool IsSuppressed() const
    6729             :   {
    6730           0 :     return mFadeIn == 0 && mFadeOut == 0;
    6731             :   }
    6732             : };
    6733             : 
    6734             : static void
    6735           0 : GetFullscreenTransitionDuration(bool aEnterFullscreen,
    6736             :                                 FullscreenTransitionDuration* aDuration)
    6737             : {
    6738             :   const char* pref = aEnterFullscreen ?
    6739             :     "full-screen-api.transition-duration.enter" :
    6740           0 :     "full-screen-api.transition-duration.leave";
    6741           0 :   nsAdoptingCString prefValue = Preferences::GetCString(pref);
    6742           0 :   if (!prefValue.IsEmpty()) {
    6743             :     sscanf(prefValue.get(), "%hu%hu",
    6744           0 :            &aDuration->mFadeIn, &aDuration->mFadeOut);
    6745             :   }
    6746           0 : }
    6747             : 
    6748             : class FullscreenTransitionTask : public Runnable
    6749             : {
    6750             : public:
    6751           0 :   FullscreenTransitionTask(const FullscreenTransitionDuration& aDuration,
    6752             :                            nsGlobalWindow* aWindow, bool aFullscreen,
    6753             :                            nsIWidget* aWidget, nsIScreen* aScreen,
    6754             :                            nsISupports* aTransitionData)
    6755             :     : mWindow(aWindow)
    6756             :     , mWidget(aWidget)
    6757             :     , mScreen(aScreen)
    6758             :     , mTransitionData(aTransitionData)
    6759             :     , mDuration(aDuration)
    6760             :     , mStage(eBeforeToggle)
    6761           0 :     , mFullscreen(aFullscreen)
    6762             :   {
    6763           0 :   }
    6764             : 
    6765             :   NS_IMETHOD Run() override;
    6766             : 
    6767             : private:
    6768           0 :   ~FullscreenTransitionTask() override
    6769           0 :   {
    6770           0 :   }
    6771             : 
    6772             :   /**
    6773             :    * The flow of fullscreen transition:
    6774             :    *
    6775             :    *         parent process         |         child process
    6776             :    * ----------------------------------------------------------------
    6777             :    *
    6778             :    *                                    | request/exit fullscreen
    6779             :    *                              <-----|
    6780             :    *         BeforeToggle stage |
    6781             :    *                            |
    6782             :    *  ToggleFullscreen stage *1 |----->
    6783             :    *                                    | HandleFullscreenRequests
    6784             :    *                                    |
    6785             :    *                              <-----| MozAfterPaint event
    6786             :    *       AfterToggle stage *2 |
    6787             :    *                            |
    6788             :    *                  End stage |
    6789             :    *
    6790             :    * Note we also start a timer at *1 so that if we don't get MozAfterPaint
    6791             :    * from the child process in time, we continue going to *2.
    6792             :    */
    6793             :   enum Stage {
    6794             :     // BeforeToggle stage happens before we enter or leave fullscreen
    6795             :     // state. In this stage, the task triggers the pre-toggle fullscreen
    6796             :     // transition on the widget.
    6797             :     eBeforeToggle,
    6798             :     // ToggleFullscreen stage actually executes the fullscreen toggle,
    6799             :     // and wait for the next paint on the content to continue.
    6800             :     eToggleFullscreen,
    6801             :     // AfterToggle stage happens after we toggle the fullscreen state.
    6802             :     // In this stage, the task triggers the post-toggle fullscreen
    6803             :     // transition on the widget.
    6804             :     eAfterToggle,
    6805             :     // End stage is triggered after the final transition finishes.
    6806             :     eEnd
    6807             :   };
    6808             : 
    6809             :   class Observer final : public nsIObserver
    6810             :   {
    6811             :   public:
    6812             :     NS_DECL_ISUPPORTS
    6813             :     NS_DECL_NSIOBSERVER
    6814             : 
    6815           0 :     explicit Observer(FullscreenTransitionTask* aTask)
    6816           0 :       : mTask(aTask) { }
    6817             : 
    6818             :   private:
    6819           0 :     ~Observer() = default;
    6820             : 
    6821             :     RefPtr<FullscreenTransitionTask> mTask;
    6822             :   };
    6823             : 
    6824             :   static const char* const kPaintedTopic;
    6825             : 
    6826             :   RefPtr<nsGlobalWindow> mWindow;
    6827             :   nsCOMPtr<nsIWidget> mWidget;
    6828             :   nsCOMPtr<nsIScreen> mScreen;
    6829             :   nsCOMPtr<nsITimer> mTimer;
    6830             :   nsCOMPtr<nsISupports> mTransitionData;
    6831             : 
    6832             :   TimeStamp mFullscreenChangeStartTime;
    6833             :   FullscreenTransitionDuration mDuration;
    6834             :   Stage mStage;
    6835             :   bool mFullscreen;
    6836             : };
    6837             : 
    6838             : const char* const
    6839             : FullscreenTransitionTask::kPaintedTopic = "fullscreen-painted";
    6840             : 
    6841             : NS_IMETHODIMP
    6842           0 : FullscreenTransitionTask::Run()
    6843             : {
    6844           0 :   Stage stage = mStage;
    6845           0 :   mStage = Stage(mStage + 1);
    6846           0 :   if (MOZ_UNLIKELY(mWidget->Destroyed())) {
    6847             :     // If the widget has been destroyed before we get here, don't try to
    6848             :     // do anything more. Just let it go and release ourselves.
    6849             :     NS_WARNING("The widget to fullscreen has been destroyed");
    6850             :     return NS_OK;
    6851             :   }
    6852           0 :   if (stage == eBeforeToggle) {
    6853           0 :     PROFILER_MARKER("Fullscreen transition start");
    6854           0 :     mWidget->PerformFullscreenTransition(nsIWidget::eBeforeFullscreenToggle,
    6855             :                                          mDuration.mFadeIn, mTransitionData,
    6856           0 :                                          this);
    6857           0 :   } else if (stage == eToggleFullscreen) {
    6858           0 :     PROFILER_MARKER("Fullscreen toggle start");
    6859           0 :     mFullscreenChangeStartTime = TimeStamp::Now();
    6860           0 :     if (MOZ_UNLIKELY(mWindow->mFullScreen != mFullscreen)) {
    6861             :       // This could happen in theory if several fullscreen requests in
    6862             :       // different direction happen continuously in a short time. We
    6863             :       // need to ensure the fullscreen state matches our target here,
    6864             :       // otherwise the widget would change the window state as if we
    6865             :       // toggle for Fullscreen Mode instead of Fullscreen API.
    6866             :       NS_WARNING("The fullscreen state of the window does not match");
    6867           0 :       mWindow->mFullScreen = mFullscreen;
    6868             :     }
    6869             :     // Toggle the fullscreen state on the widget
    6870           0 :     if (!mWindow->SetWidgetFullscreen(FullscreenReason::ForFullscreenAPI,
    6871           0 :                                       mFullscreen, mWidget, mScreen)) {
    6872             :       // Fail to setup the widget, call FinishFullscreenChange to
    6873             :       // complete fullscreen change directly.
    6874           0 :       mWindow->FinishFullscreenChange(mFullscreen);
    6875             :     }
    6876             :     // Set observer for the next content paint.
    6877           0 :     nsCOMPtr<nsIObserver> observer = new Observer(this);
    6878           0 :     nsCOMPtr<nsIObserverService> obs = mozilla::services::GetObserverService();
    6879           0 :     obs->AddObserver(observer, kPaintedTopic, false);
    6880             :     // There are several edge cases where we may never get the paint
    6881             :     // notification, including:
    6882             :     // 1. the window/tab is closed before the next paint;
    6883             :     // 2. the user has switched to another tab before we get here.
    6884             :     // Completely fixing those cases seems to be tricky, and since they
    6885             :     // should rarely happen, it probably isn't worth to fix. Hence we
    6886             :     // simply add a timeout here to ensure we never hang forever.
    6887             :     // In addition, if the page is complicated or the machine is less
    6888             :     // powerful, layout could take a long time, in which case, staying
    6889             :     // in black screen for that long could hurt user experience even
    6890             :     // more than exposing an intermediate state.
    6891           0 :     mTimer = do_CreateInstance(NS_TIMER_CONTRACTID);
    6892             :     uint32_t timeout =
    6893           0 :       Preferences::GetUint("full-screen-api.transition.timeout", 1000);
    6894           0 :     mTimer->Init(observer, timeout, nsITimer::TYPE_ONE_SHOT);
    6895           0 :   } else if (stage == eAfterToggle) {
    6896             :     Telemetry::AccumulateTimeDelta(Telemetry::FULLSCREEN_TRANSITION_BLACK_MS,
    6897           0 :                                    mFullscreenChangeStartTime);
    6898           0 :     mWidget->PerformFullscreenTransition(nsIWidget::eAfterFullscreenToggle,
    6899             :                                          mDuration.mFadeOut, mTransitionData,
    6900           0 :                                          this);
    6901           0 :   } else if (stage == eEnd) {
    6902           0 :     PROFILER_MARKER("Fullscreen transition end");
    6903             :   }
    6904             :   return NS_OK;
    6905             : }
    6906             : 
    6907           0 : NS_IMPL_ISUPPORTS(FullscreenTransitionTask::Observer, nsIObserver)
    6908             : 
    6909             : NS_IMETHODIMP
    6910           0 : FullscreenTransitionTask::Observer::Observe(nsISupports* aSubject,
    6911             :                                             const char* aTopic,
    6912             :                                             const char16_t* aData)
    6913             : {
    6914           0 :   bool shouldContinue = false;
    6915           0 :   if (strcmp(aTopic, FullscreenTransitionTask::kPaintedTopic) == 0) {
    6916           0 :     nsCOMPtr<nsPIDOMWindowInner> win(do_QueryInterface(aSubject));
    6917             :     nsCOMPtr<nsIWidget> widget = win ?
    6918           0 :       nsGlobalWindow::Cast(win)->GetMainWidget() : nullptr;
    6919           0 :     if (widget == mTask->mWidget) {
    6920             :       // The paint notification arrives first. Cancel the timer.
    6921           0 :       mTask->mTimer->Cancel();
    6922           0 :       shouldContinue = true;
    6923           0 :       PROFILER_MARKER("Fullscreen toggle end");
    6924             :     }
    6925             :   } else {
    6926             : #ifdef DEBUG
    6927             :     MOZ_ASSERT(strcmp(aTopic, NS_TIMER_CALLBACK_TOPIC) == 0,
    6928             :                "Should only get fullscreen-painted or timer-callback");

    6930             :     MOZ_ASSERT(timer && timer == mTask->mTimer,
    6931             :                "Should only trigger this with the timer the task created");
    6932             : #endif
    6933           0 :     shouldContinue = true;
    6934           0 :     PROFILER_MARKER("Fullscreen toggle timeout");
    6935             :   }
    6936           0 :   if (shouldContinue) {
    6937           0 :     nsCOMPtr<nsIObserverService> obs = mozilla::services::GetObserverService();
    6938           0 :     obs->RemoveObserver(this, kPaintedTopic);
    6939           0 :     mTask->mTimer = nullptr;
    6940           0 :     mTask->Run();
    6941             :   }
    6942           0 :   return NS_OK;
    6943             : }

    6945             : static bool

    6956             :   nsCOMPtr<nsISupports> transitionData;

    6958           0 :     GetFullscreenTransitionDuration(aFullscreen, &duration);

    6960             :       performTransition = widget->
    6961           0 :         PrepareForFullscreenTransition(getter_AddRefs(transitionData));
    6962             :     }
    6963             :   }
    6964             :   // We pass nullptr as the screen to SetWidgetFullscreen
    6965             :   // and FullscreenTransitionTask, as we do not wish to override
    6966             :   // the default screen selection behavior.  The screen containing
    6967             :   // most of the widget will be selected.

    7278             : // static
    7279             : void
    7280           0 : nsGlobalWindow::MakeScriptDialogTitle(nsAString& aOutTitle,
    7281             :                                       nsIPrincipal* aSubjectPrincipal)
    7282             : {
    7283             :   MOZ_ASSERT(aSubjectPrincipal);
    7284             : 
    7285             :   aOutTitle.Truncate();
    7286             : 
    7287             :   // Try to get a host from the running principal -- this will do the
    7288             :   // right thing for javascript: and data: documents.
    7289             : 
    7290             :   nsCOMPtr<nsIURI> uri;
    7291           0 :   nsresult rv = aSubjectPrincipal->GetURI(getter_AddRefs(uri));
    7292             :   // Note - The check for the current JSContext here isn't necessarily sensical.
    7293             :   // It's just designed to preserve existing behavior during a mass-conversion
    7294             :   // patch.
    7295           0 :   if (NS_SUCCEEDED(rv) && uri && nsContentUtils::GetCurrentJSContext()) {
    7296             :     // remove user:pass for privacy and spoof prevention
    7297             : 
    7298           0 :     nsCOMPtr<nsIURIFixup> fixup(do_GetService(NS_URIFIXUP_CONTRACTID));

    7300             :       nsCOMPtr<nsIURI> fixedURI;
    7301           0 :       rv = fixup->CreateExposableURI(uri, getter_AddRefs(fixedURI));
    7302           0 :       if (NS_SUCCEEDED(rv) && fixedURI) {
    7303           0 :         nsAutoCString host;
    7304           0 :         fixedURI->GetHost(host);
    7305             : 
    7306           0 :         if (!host.IsEmpty()) {
    7307             :           // if this URI has a host we'll show it. For other
    7308             :           // schemes (e.g. file:) we fall back to the localized
    7309             :           // generic string
    7310             : 
    7311           0 :           nsAutoCString prepath;
    7312           0 :           fixedURI->GetPrePath(prepath);
    7313             : 
    7314           0 :           NS_ConvertUTF8toUTF16 ucsPrePath(prepath);

    8381           0 :   FlushPendingNotifications(FlushType::Layout);
    8382           0 :   nsIScrollableFrame *sf = GetScrollFrame();
    8383             : 
    8384           0 :   if (sf) {
    8385             :     // Here we calculate what the max pixel value is that we can
    8386             :     // scroll to, we do this by dividing maxint with the pixel to
    8387             :     // twips conversion factor, and subtracting 4, the 4 comes from
    8388             :     // experimenting with this value, anything less makes the view
    8389             :     // code not scroll correctly, I have no idea why. -- jst
    8390           0 :     const int32_t maxpx = nsPresContext::AppUnitsToIntCSSPixels(0x7fffffff) - 4;
    8391             : 
    8392           0 :     CSSIntPoint scroll(aScroll);
    8393           0 :     if (scroll.x > maxpx) {
    8394           0 :       scroll.x = maxpx;
    8395             :     }
    8396             : 
    8397           0 :     if (scroll.y > maxpx) {
    8398           0 :       scroll.y = maxpx;
    8399             :     }
    8400             :

    8405           0 :                             : nsIScrollableFrame::INSTANT);
    8406             :   }

    8556           0 :   pm->TestPermission(aDoc->NodePrincipal(), &permission);
    8557           0 :   return permission == nsIPopupWindowManager::DENY_POPUP;
    8558             : }

    8617             : 
    8618             : /*
    8619             :  * Examine the current document state to see if we're in a way that is
    8620             :  * typically abused by web designers. The window.open code uses this
    8621             :  * routine to determine whether to allow the new window.
    8622             :  * Returns a value from the PopupControlState enum.
    8623             :  */
    8624             : PopupControlState
    8625           0 : nsGlobalWindow::RevisePopupAbuseLevel(PopupControlState aControl)
    8626             : {
    8627             :   MOZ_ASSERT(IsOuterWindow());
    8628             : 
    8629             :   NS_ASSERTION(mDocShell, "Must have docshell");
    8630             : 
    8631           0 :   if (mDocShell->ItemType() != nsIDocShellTreeItem::typeContent) {
    8632             :     return openAllowed;
    8633             :   }
    8634             : 
    8635           0 :   PopupControlState abuse = aControl;
    8636           0 :   switch (abuse) {
    8637             :   case openControlled:
    8638             :   case openAbused:
    8639             :   case openOverridden:
    8640           0 :     if (PopupWhitelisted())
    8641           0 :       abuse = PopupControlState(abuse - 1);
    8642             :     break;
    8643             :   case openAllowed: break;
    8644             :   default:
    8645             :     NS_WARNING("Strange PopupControlState!");
    8646             :   }
    8647             : 
    8648             :   // limit the number of simultaneously open popups
    8649           0 :   if (abuse == openAbused || abuse == openControlled) {
    8650           0 :     int32_t popupMax = Preferences::GetInt("dom.popup_maximum", -1);
    8651           0 :     if (popupMax >= 0 && gOpenPopupSpamCount >= popupMax)
    8652           0 :       abuse = openOverridden;
    8653             :   }
    8654             : 
    8655           0 :   return abuse;
    8656             : }

    8848             : 
    8849             : nsGlobalWindow*
    8850           0 : nsGlobalWindow::CallerInnerWindow()
    8851             : {
    8852           0 :   JSContext *cx = nsContentUtils::GetCurrentJSContext();
    8853           0 :   NS_ENSURE_TRUE(cx, nullptr);
    8854           0 :   nsIGlobalObject* global = GetIncumbentGlobal();
    8855           0 :   NS_ENSURE_TRUE(global, nullptr);
    8856           0 :   JS::Rooted<JSObject*> scope(cx, global->GetGlobalJSObject());
    8857           0 :   NS_ENSURE_TRUE(scope, nullptr);
    8858             : 
    8859             :   // When Jetpack runs content scripts inside a sandbox, it uses
    8860             :   // sandboxPrototype to make them appear as though they're running in the
    8861             :   // scope of the page. So when a content script invokes postMessage, it expects
    8862             :   // the |source| of the received message to be the window set as the
    8863             :   // sandboxPrototype. This used to work incidentally for unrelated reasons, but
    8864             :   // now we need to do some special handling to support it.
    8865           0 :   if (xpc::IsSandbox(scope)) {
    8866           0 :     JSAutoCompartment ac(cx, scope);
    8867           0 :     JS::Rooted<JSObject*> scopeProto(cx);
    8868           0 :     bool ok = JS_GetPrototype(cx, scope, &scopeProto);
    8869           0 :     NS_ENSURE_TRUE(ok, nullptr);
    8870           0 :     if (scopeProto && xpc::IsSandboxPrototypeProxy(scopeProto) &&
    8871           0 :         (scopeProto = js::CheckedUnwrap(scopeProto, /* stopAtWindowProxy = */ false)))
    8872             :     {
    8873           0 :       global = xpc::NativeGlobal(scopeProto);
    8874           0 :       NS_ENSURE_TRUE(global, nullptr);
    8875           0 :     }
    8876             :   }
    8877             : 
    8878             :   // The calling window must be holding a reference, so we can return a weak
    8879             :   // pointer.
    8880           0 :   nsCOMPtr<nsPIDOMWindowInner> win = do_QueryInterface(global);
    8881           0 :   return nsGlobalWindow::Cast(win);
    8882             : }
    8883             : 
    8884             : void
    8885           0 : nsGlobalWindow::PostMessageMozOuter(JSContext* aCx, JS::Handle<JS::Value> aMessage,
    8886             :                                     const nsAString& aTargetOrigin,
    8887             :                                     JS::Handle<JS::Value> aTransfer,
    8888             :                                     nsIPrincipal& aSubjectPrincipal,
    8889             :                                     ErrorResult& aError)
    8890             : {
    8891           0 :   MOZ_RELEASE_ASSERT(IsOuterWindow());
    8892             : 
    8893             :   //
    8894             :   // Window.postMessage is an intentional subversion of the same-origin policy.
    8895             :   // As such, this code must be particularly careful in the information it
    8896             :   // exposes to calling code.
    8897             :   //
    8898             :   // http://www.whatwg.org/specs/web-apps/current-work/multipage/section-crossDocumentMessages.html
    8899             :   //
    8900             : 
    8901             :   // First, get the caller's window
    8902           0 :   RefPtr<nsGlobalWindow> callerInnerWin = CallerInnerWindow();
    8903             :   nsIPrincipal* callerPrin;
    8904           0 :   if (callerInnerWin) {
    8905             :     MOZ_ASSERT(callerInnerWin->IsInnerWindow(),
    8906             :                "should have gotten an inner window here");
    8907             : 
    8908             :     // Compute the caller's origin either from its principal or, in the case the
    8909             :     // principal doesn't carry a URI (e.g. the system principal), the caller's
    8910             :     // document.  We must get this now instead of when the event is created and
    8911             :     // dispatched, because ultimately it is the identity of the calling window
    8912             :     // *now* that determines who sent the message (and not an identity which might
    8913             :     // have changed due to intervening navigations).
    8914           0 :     callerPrin = callerInnerWin->GetPrincipal();
    8915             :   }
    8916             :   else {
    8917             :     // In case the global is not a window, it can be a sandbox, and the sandbox's
    8918             :     // principal can be used for the security check.
    8919           0 :     nsIGlobalObject* global = GetIncumbentGlobal();
    8920             :     NS_ASSERTION(global, "Why is there no global object?");
    8921           0 :     callerPrin = global->PrincipalOrNull();
    8922             :   }
    8923           0 :   if (!callerPrin) {
    8924           0 :     return;
    8925             :   }
    8926             : 
    8927             :   nsCOMPtr<nsIURI> callerOuterURI;
    8928           0 :   if (NS_FAILED(callerPrin->GetURI(getter_AddRefs(callerOuterURI)))) {
    8929             :     return;
    8930             :   }
    8931             : 
    8932           0 :   nsAutoString origin;
    8933           0 :   if (callerOuterURI) {
    8934             :     // if the principal has a URI, use that to generate the origin
    8935           0 :     nsContentUtils::GetUTFOrigin(callerPrin, origin);
    8936             :   }
    8937           0 :   else if (callerInnerWin) {
    8938             :     // otherwise use the URI of the document to generate origin
    8939           0 :     nsCOMPtr<nsIDocument> doc = callerInnerWin->GetExtantDoc();

    8941             :       return;
    8942             :     }
    8943           0 :     callerOuterURI = doc->GetDocumentURI();

    8945           0 :     nsContentUtils::GetUTFOrigin(callerOuterURI, origin);
    8946             :   }

    8948             :     // in case of a sandbox with a system principal origin can be empty
    8949           0 :     if (!nsContentUtils::IsSystemPrincipal(callerPrin)) {
    8950             :       return;
    8951             :     }
    8952             :   }
    8953             : 
    8954             :   // Convert the provided origin string into a URI for comparison purposes.
    8955             :   nsCOMPtr<nsIPrincipal> providedPrincipal;

    8957           0 :   if (aTargetOrigin.EqualsASCII("/")) {
    8958             :     providedPrincipal = callerPrin;

    8961           0 :   else if (!aTargetOrigin.EqualsASCII("*")) {

    8967             :

    8971             :     }
    8972             : 
    8973           0 :     OriginAttributes attrs = aSubjectPrincipal.OriginAttributesRef();

    8975           0 :       auto principal = BasePrincipal::Cast(GetPrincipal());
    8976             : 
    8977           0 :       if (attrs != principal->OriginAttributesRef()) {
    8978             :         nsCOMPtr<nsIURI> targetURI;

    9103           0 : nsGlobalWindow::CanClose()

    9109           0 :     nsIDOMChromeWindow* chromeWin = static_cast<nsGlobalChromeWindow*>(this);
    9110           0 :     chromeWin->GetBrowserDOMWindow(getter_AddRefs(bwin));
    9111             : 
    9112           0 :     bool canClose = true;
    9113           0 :     if (bwin && NS_SUCCEEDED(bwin->CanClose(&canClose))) {
    9114           0 :       return canClose;
    9115             :     }
    9116             :   }
    9117             : 
    9118           0 :   if (!mDocShell) {
    9119             :     return true;
    9120             :   }
    9121             : 
    9122             :   // Ask the content viewer whether the toplevel window can close.
    9123             :   // If the content viewer returns false, it is responsible for calling
    9124             :   // Close() as soon as it is possible for the window to close.
    9125             :   // This allows us to not close the window while printing is happening.
    9126             : 
    9127             :   nsCOMPtr<nsIContentViewer> cv;
    9128           0 :   mDocShell->GetContentViewer(getter_AddRefs(cv));
    9129           0 :   if (cv) {

    9131           0 :     nsresult rv = cv->PermitUnload(&canClose);
    9132           0 :     if (NS_SUCCEEDED(rv) && !canClose)
    9133           0 :       return false;
    9134             : 
    9135           0 :     rv = cv->RequestWindowClose(&canClose);
    9136           0 :     if (NS_SUCCEEDED(rv) && !canClose)
    9137             :       return false;
    9138             :   }
    9139             : 
    9140             :   return true;
    9141             : }

    9143             : void
    9144           0 : nsGlobalWindow::CloseOuter(bool aTrustedCaller)
    9145             : {
    9146           0 :   MOZ_RELEASE_ASSERT(IsOuterWindow());
    9147             : 
    9148           0 :   if (!mDocShell || IsInModalState() ||
    9149           0 :       (IsFrame() && !mDocShell->GetIsMozBrowser())) {
    9150             :     // window.close() is called on a frame in a frameset, on a window
    9151             :     // that's already closed, or on a window for which there's
    9152             :     // currently a modal dialog open. Ignore such calls.
    9153           0 :     return;
    9154             :   }
    9155             : 
    9156           0 :   if (mHavePendingClose) {
    9157             :     // We're going to be closed anyway; do nothing since we don't want
    9158             :     // to double-close
    9159             :     return;
    9160             :   }
    9161             : 
    9162           0 :   if (mBlockScriptedClosingFlag)
    9163             :   {

    9165             :     // the window to be closed directly after this event,
    9166             :     // so the user can see that there was a blocked popup.
    9167             :     return;

    9198             :   // be closed. The tab UI code may choose to cancel the default
    9199             :   // action for this event, if so, we won't actually close the window

    9257             : void
    9258           0 : nsGlobalWindow::FinalClose()
    9259             : {
    9260             :   MOZ_ASSERT(IsOuterWindow());
    9261             : 
    9262             :   // Flag that we were closed.
    9263           0 :   mIsClosed = true;
    9264             : 
    9265             :   // If we get here from CloseOuter then it means that the parent process is
    9266             :   // going to close our window for us. It's just important to set mIsClosed.
    9267           0 :   if (XRE_GetProcessType() == GeckoProcessType_Content) {
    9268           0 :     return;
    9269             :   }
    9270             : 
    9271             :   // This stuff is non-sensical but incredibly fragile. The reasons for the
    9272             :   // behavior here don't make sense today and may not have ever made sense,
    9273             :   // but various bits of frontend code break when you change them. If you need
    9274             :   // to fix up this behavior, feel free to. It's a righteous task, but involves
    9275             :   // wrestling with various download manager tests, frontend code, and possible
    9276             :   // broken addons. The chrome tests in toolkit/mozapps/downloads are a good
    9277             :   // testing ground.
    9278             :   //
    9279             :   // In particular, if some inner of |win| is the entry global, we must
    9280             :   // complete _two_ round-trips to the event loop before the call to
    9281             :   // ReallyCloseWindow. This allows setTimeout handlers that are set after
    9282             :   // FinalClose() is called to run before the window is torn down.
    9283             :   nsCOMPtr<nsPIDOMWindowInner> entryWindow =
    9284           0 :     do_QueryInterface(GetEntryGlobal());
    9285             :   bool indirect =
    9286           0 :     entryWindow && entryWindow->GetOuterWindow() == this->AsOuter();
    9287           0 :   if (NS_FAILED(nsCloseEvent::PostCloseEvent(this, indirect))) {
    9288           0 :     ReallyCloseWindow();
    9289             :   } else {
    9290           0 :     mHavePendingClose = true;
    9291             :   }
    9292             : }
    9293             : 
    9294             : 
    9295             : void
    9296           0 : nsGlobalWindow::ReallyCloseWindow()
    9297             : {
    9298           0 :   FORWARD_TO_OUTER_VOID(ReallyCloseWindow, ());
    9299             : 
    9300             :   // Make sure we never reenter this method.
    9301           0 :   mHavePendingClose = true;
    9302             : 
    9303           0 :   nsCOMPtr<nsIBaseWindow> treeOwnerAsWin = GetTreeOwnerWindow();
    9304             : 
    9305             :   // If there's no treeOwnerAsWin, this window must already be closed.
    9306             : 
    9307           0 :   if (treeOwnerAsWin) {
    9308             : 
    9309             :     // but if we're a browser window we could be in some nasty
    9310             :     // self-destroying cascade that we should mostly ignore
    9311             : 
    9312           0 :     if (mDocShell) {
    9313             :       nsCOMPtr<nsIBrowserDOMWindow> bwin;
    9314             :       nsCOMPtr<nsIDocShellTreeItem> rootItem;
    9315           0 :       mDocShell->GetRootTreeItem(getter_AddRefs(rootItem));
    9316             :       nsCOMPtr<nsPIDOMWindowOuter> rootWin =
    9317           0 :        rootItem ? rootItem->GetWindow() : nullptr;
    9318           0 :       nsCOMPtr<nsIDOMChromeWindow> chromeWin(do_QueryInterface(rootWin));
    9319           0 :       if (chromeWin)
    9320           0 :         chromeWin->GetBrowserDOMWindow(getter_AddRefs(bwin));
    9321             : 
    9322           0 :       if (rootWin) {
    9323             :         /* Normally we destroy the entire window, but not if
    9324             :            this DOM window belongs to a tabbed browser and doesn't
    9325             :            correspond to a tab. This allows a well-behaved tab
    9326             :            to destroy the container as it should but is a final measure
    9327             :            to prevent an errant tab from doing so when it shouldn't.
    9328             :            This works because we reach this code when we shouldn't only
    9329             :            in the particular circumstance that we belong to a tab
    9330             :            that has just been closed (and is therefore already missing
    9331             :            from the list of browsers) (and has an unload handler
    9332             :            that closes the window). */
    9333             :         // XXXbz now that we have mHavePendingClose, is this needed?
    9334           0 :         bool isTab = false;
    9335           0 :         if (rootWin == AsOuter() ||
    9336           0 :             !bwin || (bwin->IsTabContentWindow(GetOuterWindowInternal(),
    9337           0 :                                                &isTab), isTab))
    9338           0 :           treeOwnerAsWin->Destroy();
    9339             :       }
    9340             :     }
    9341             : 
    9342           0 :     CleanUp();
    9343             :   }
    9344             : }
    9345             : 
    9346             : void
    9347           0 : nsGlobalWindow::EnterModalState()
    9348             : {
    9349             :   MOZ_ASSERT(IsOuterWindow(), "Modal state is maintained on outer windows");

    9352             :   // <iframe mozbrowser>.
    9353           0 :   nsGlobalWindow* topWin = GetScriptableTopInternal();
    9354             : 
    9355           0 :   if (!topWin) {
    9356             :     NS_ERROR("Uh, EnterModalState() called w/o a reachable top window?");
    9357           0 :     return;
    9358             :   }
    9359             : 
    9360             :   // If there is an active ESM in this window, clear it. Otherwise, this can
    9361             :   // cause a problem if a modal state is entered during a mouseup event.
    9362             :   EventStateManager* activeESM =
    9363             :     static_cast<EventStateManager*>(
    9364           0 :       EventStateManager::GetActiveEventStateManager());
    9365           0 :   if (activeESM && activeESM->GetPresContext()) {

    9734             : 
    9735           0 :   aToken.Assign(Substring(start, aIter));

    9739             : // Helper for converting window.showModalDialog() options (list of ';'

    9741             : // our normal window opening code.
    9742             : 
    9743             : /* static */
    9744             : void
    9745           0 : nsGlobalWindow::ConvertDialogOptions(const nsAString& aOptions,
    9746             :                                      nsAString& aResult)
    9747             : {
    9748             :   nsAString::const_iterator end;
    9749           0 :   aOptions.EndReading(end);
    9750             : 
    9751             :   nsAString::const_iterator iter;
    9752           0 :   aOptions.BeginReading(iter);
    9753             : 
    9754           0 :   nsAutoString token;
    9755           0 :   nsAutoString name;
    9756           0 :   nsAutoString value;
    9757             : 
    9758             :   while (true) {
    9759           0 :     if (!TokenizeDialogOptions(name, iter, end)) {
    9760             :       break;
    9761             :     }
    9762             : 
    9763             :     // Invalid name.
    9764           0 :     if (name.EqualsLiteral("=") ||
    9765           0 :         name.EqualsLiteral(":") ||
    9766           0 :         name.EqualsLiteral(";")) {
    9767             :       break;
    9768             :     }
    9769             : 
    9770           0 :     if (!TokenizeDialogOptions(token, iter, end)) {
    9771             :       break;
    9772             :     }
    9773             : 
    9774           0 :     if (!token.EqualsLiteral(":") && !token.EqualsLiteral("=")) {
    9775             :       continue;
    9776             :     }
    9777             : 
    9778             :     // We found name followed by ':' or '='. Look for a value.
    9779           0 :     if (!TokenizeDialogOptions(value, iter, end)) {
    9780             :       break;

    9782             : 
    9783           0 :     if (name.LowerCaseEqualsLiteral("center")) {
    9784           0 :       if (value.LowerCaseEqualsLiteral("on")  ||

    9786           0 :           value.LowerCaseEqualsLiteral("1")) {
    9787           0 :         aResult.AppendLiteral(",centerscreen=1");

   10942             : 
   10943             : // Find an nsICanvasFrame under aFrame.  Only search the principal
   10944             : // child lists.  aFrame must be non-null.
   10945           0 : static nsCanvasFrame* FindCanvasFrame(nsIFrame* aFrame)
   10946             : {
   10947           0 :     nsCanvasFrame* canvasFrame = do_QueryFrame(aFrame);

   11408             : bool
   11409           0 : nsGlobalWindow::ContainsIdleObserver(nsIIdleObserver* aIdleObserver, uint32_t aTimeInS)
   11410             : {
   11411             :   MOZ_ASSERT(aIdleObserver, "Idle observer not instantiated.");

   11414           0 :   while (iter.HasMore()) {
   11415           0 :     IdleObserverHolder& idleObserver = iter.GetNext();

   11417           0 :         idleObserver.mTimeInS == aTimeInS) {
   11418             :       found = true;
   11419             :       break;
   11420             :     }
   11421             :   }
   11422           0 :   return found;
   11423             : }

   12240             : void
   12241           0 : nsGlobalWindow::Suspend()
   12242             : {
   12243             :   MOZ_ASSERT(NS_IsMainThread());
   12244           0 :   MOZ_DIAGNOSTIC_ASSERT(IsInnerWindow());
   12245             : 
   12246             :   // We can only safely suspend windows that are the current inner window.  If
   12247             :   // its not the current inner, then we are in one of two different cases.
   12248             :   // Either we are in the bfcache or we are doomed window that is going away.
   12249             :   // When a window becomes inactive we purposely avoid placing already suspended
   12250             :   // windows into the bfcache.  It only expects windows suspended due to the
   12251             :   // Freeze() method which occurs while the window is still the current inner.
   12252             :   // So we must not call Suspend() on bfcache windows at this point or this
   12253             :   // invariant will be broken.  If the window is doomed there is no point in
   12254             :   // suspending it since it will soon be gone.
   12255           0 :   if (!AsInner()->IsCurrentInnerWindow()) {
   12256           0 :     return;
   12257             :   }
   12258             : 
   12259             :   // All children are also suspended.  This ensure mSuspendDepth is
   12260             :   // set properly and the timers are properly canceled for each child.
   12261           0 :   CallOnChildren(&nsGlobalWindow::Suspend);
   12262             : 
   12263           0 :   mSuspendDepth += 1;
   12264           0 :   if (mSuspendDepth != 1) {
   12265             :     return;
   12266             :   }
   12267             : 
   12268           0 :   nsCOMPtr<nsIDeviceSensors> ac = do_GetService(NS_DEVICE_SENSORS_CONTRACTID);
   12269           0 :   if (ac) {
   12270           0 :     for (uint32_t i = 0; i < mEnabledSensors.Length(); i++)
   12271           0 :       ac->RemoveWindowListener(mEnabledSensors[i], this);
   12272             :   }
   12273           0 :   DisableGamepadUpdates();
   12274           0 :   DisableVRUpdates();
   12275             : 
   12276           0 :   mozilla::dom::workers::SuspendWorkersForWindow(AsInner());
   12277             :

   12289             : void
   12290           0 : nsGlobalWindow::Resume()
   12291             : {
   12292             :   MOZ_ASSERT(NS_IsMainThread());
   12293           0 :   MOZ_DIAGNOSTIC_ASSERT(IsInnerWindow());
   12294             : 
   12295             :   // We can only safely resume a window if its the current inner window.  If
   12296             :   // its not the current inner, then we are in one of two different cases.
   12297             :   // Either we are in the bfcache or we are doomed window that is going away.
   12298             :   // If a window is suspended when it becomes inactive we purposely do not
   12299             :   // put it in the bfcache, so Resume should never be needed in that case.
   12300             :   // If the window is doomed then there is no point in resuming it.
   12301           0 :   if (!AsInner()->IsCurrentInnerWindow()) {
   12302           0 :     return;
   12303             :   }
   12304             : 
   12305             :   // Resume all children.  This restores timers recursively canceled
   12306             :   // in Suspend() and ensures all children have the correct mSuspendDepth.
   12307           0 :   CallOnChildren(&nsGlobalWindow::Resume);
   12308             : 
   12309             :   MOZ_ASSERT(mSuspendDepth != 0);
   12310           0 :   mSuspendDepth -= 1;
   12311           0 :   if (mSuspendDepth != 0) {
   12312             :     return;
   12313             :   }
   12314             : 
   12315             :   // We should not be able to resume a frozen window.  It must be Thaw()'d first.
   12316             :   MOZ_ASSERT(mFreezeDepth == 0);

   12435             : void
   12436           0 : nsGlobalWindow::SyncStateFromParentWindow()
   12437             : {
   12438             :   // This method should only be called on an inner window that has been
   12439             :   // assigned to an outer window already.
   12440             :   MOZ_ASSERT(IsInnerWindow());
   12441             :   MOZ_ASSERT(AsInner()->IsCurrentInnerWindow());
   12442           0 :   nsPIDOMWindowOuter* outer = GetOuterWindow();
   12443             :   MOZ_ASSERT(outer);
   12444             : 
   12445             :   // Attempt to find our parent windows.
   12446           0 :   nsCOMPtr<Element> frame = outer->GetFrameElementInternal();
   12447           0 :   nsPIDOMWindowOuter* parentOuter = frame ? frame->OwnerDoc()->GetWindow()
   12448           0 :                                           : nullptr;
   12449             :   nsGlobalWindow* parentInner =
   12450           0 :     parentOuter ? nsGlobalWindow::Cast(parentOuter->GetCurrentInnerWindow())
   12451           0 :                 : nullptr;
   12452             : 
   12453             :   // If our outer is in a modal state, but our parent is not in a modal
   12454             :   // state, then we must apply the suspend directly.  If our parent is
   12455             :   // in a modal state then we should get the suspend automatically
   12456             :   // via the parentSuspendDepth application below.
   12457           0 :   if ((!parentInner || !parentInner->IsInModalState()) && IsInModalState()) {
   12458           0 :     Suspend();
   12459             :   }
   12460             : 
   12461           0 :   uint32_t parentFreezeDepth = parentInner ? parentInner->mFreezeDepth : 0;
   12462           0 :   uint32_t parentSuspendDepth = parentInner ? parentInner->mSuspendDepth : 0;
   12463             : 
   12464             :   // Since every Freeze() calls Suspend(), the suspend count must
   12465             :   // be equal or greater to the freeze count.
   12466             :   MOZ_ASSERT(parentFreezeDepth <= parentSuspendDepth);
   12467             : 
   12468             :   // First apply the Freeze() calls.
   12469           0 :   for (uint32_t i = 0; i < parentFreezeDepth; ++i) {
   12470           0 :     Freeze();
   12471             :   }
   12472             : 
   12473             :   // Now apply only the number of Suspend() calls to reach the target
   12474             :   // suspend count after applying the Freeze() calls.
   12475           0 :   for (uint32_t i = 0; i < (parentSuspendDepth - parentFreezeDepth); ++i) {
   12476           0 :     Suspend();
   12477             :   }
   12478           0 : }
   12479             :

   12975             :   }
