   12984             : bool
   12985           0 : nsGlobalWindow::RunTimeoutHandler(Timeout* aTimeout,
   12986             :                                   nsIScriptContext* aScx)
   12987             : {
   12988             :   MOZ_ASSERT(IsInnerWindow());
   12989             : 
   12990             :   // Hold on to the timeout in case mExpr or mFunObj releases its
   12991             :   // doc.
   12992           0 :   RefPtr<Timeout> timeout = aTimeout;
   12993           0 :   Timeout* last_running_timeout = mTimeoutManager->BeginRunningTimeout(timeout);
   12994           0 :   timeout->mRunning = true;
   12995             : 
   12996             :   // Push this timeout's popup control state, which should only be
   12997             :   // eabled the first time a timeout fires that was created while
   12998             :   // popups were enabled and with a delay less than
   12999             :   // "dom.disable_open_click_delay".
   13000           0 :   nsAutoPopupStatePusher popupStatePusher(timeout->mPopupState);
   13001             : 
   13002             :   // Clear the timeout's popup state, if any, to prevent interval
   13003             :   // timeouts from repeatedly opening poups.
   13004           0 :   timeout->mPopupState = openAbused;
   13005             : 
   13006           0 :   bool trackNestingLevel = !timeout->mIsInterval;
   13007             :   uint32_t nestingLevel;
   13008           0 :   if (trackNestingLevel) {
   13009           0 :     nestingLevel = TimeoutManager::GetNestingLevel();
   13010           0 :     TimeoutManager::SetNestingLevel(timeout->mNestingLevel);
   13011             :   }
   13012             : 
   13013             :   const char *reason;
   13014           0 :   if (timeout->mIsInterval) {
   13015             :     reason = "setInterval handler";
   13016             :   } else {
   13017           0 :     reason = "setTimeout handler";
   13018             :   }
   13019             : 
   13020           0 :   bool abortIntervalHandler = false;
   13021           0 :   nsCOMPtr<nsIScriptTimeoutHandler> handler(do_QueryInterface(timeout->mScriptHandler));
   13022           0 :   if (handler) {
   13023           0 :     RefPtr<Function> callback = handler->GetCallback();
   13024             : 
   13025           0 :     if (!callback) {
   13026             :       // Evaluate the timeout expression.
   13027           0 :       const nsAString& script = handler->GetHandlerText();
   13028             : 
   13029           0 :       const char* filename = nullptr;
   13030           0 :       uint32_t lineNo = 0, dummyColumn = 0;
   13031           0 :       handler->GetLocation(&filename, &lineNo, &dummyColumn);
   13032             : 
   13033             :       // New script entry point required, due to the "Create a script" sub-step of
   13034             :       // http://www.whatwg.org/specs/web-apps/current-work/#timer-initialisation-steps
   13035             :       nsAutoMicroTask mt;
   13036           0 :       AutoEntryScript aes(this, reason, true);
   13037           0 :       JS::CompileOptions options(aes.cx());
   13038           0 :       options.setFileAndLine(filename, lineNo).setVersion(JSVERSION_DEFAULT);
   13039             :       options.setNoScriptRval(true);
   13040           0 :       JS::Rooted<JSObject*> global(aes.cx(), FastGetGlobalJSObject());
   13041           0 :       nsresult rv = NS_OK;
   13042             :       {
   13043           0 :         nsJSUtils::ExecutionContext exec(aes.cx(), global);
   13044           0 :         rv = exec.CompileAndExec(options, script);
   13045             :       }
   13046             : 
   13047           0 :       if (rv == NS_SUCCESS_DOM_SCRIPT_EVALUATION_THREW_UNCATCHABLE) {
   13048           0 :         abortIntervalHandler = true;
   13049             :       }
   13050             :     } else {
   13051             :       // Hold strong ref to ourselves while we call the callback.
   13052           0 :       nsCOMPtr<nsISupports> me(static_cast<nsIDOMWindow*>(this));
   13053             :       ErrorResult rv;
   13054           0 :       JS::Rooted<JS::Value> ignoredVal(RootingCx());
   13055           0 :       callback->Call(me, handler->GetArgs(), &ignoredVal, rv, reason);
   13056           0 :       if (rv.IsUncatchableException()) {
   13057           0 :         abortIntervalHandler = true;
   13058             :       }
   13059             : 
   13060           0 :       rv.SuppressException();
   13061           0 :     }
   13062             :   } else {
   13063           0 :     nsCOMPtr<nsITimeoutHandler> basicHandler(timeout->mScriptHandler);
   13064           0 :     nsCOMPtr<nsISupports> kungFuDeathGrip(static_cast<nsIDOMWindow*>(this));
   13065           0 :     mozilla::Unused << kungFuDeathGrip;
   13066           0 :     basicHandler->Call();
   13067             :   }
   13068             : 
   13069             :   // If we received an uncatchable exception, do not schedule the timeout again.
   13070             :   // This allows the slow script dialog to break easy DoS attacks like
   13071             :   // setInterval(function() { while(1); }, 100);
   13072           0 :   if (abortIntervalHandler) {
   13073             :     // If it wasn't an interval timer to begin with, this does nothing.  If it
   13074             :     // was, we'll treat it as a timeout that we just ran and discard it when
   13075             :     // we return.
   13076           0 :     timeout->mIsInterval = false;
   13077             :    }
   13078             : 
   13079             :   // We ignore any failures from calling EvaluateString() on the context or
   13080             :   // Call() on a Function here since we're in a loop
   13081             :   // where we're likely to be running timeouts whose OS timers
   13082             :   // didn't fire in time and we don't want to not fire those timers
   13083             :   // now just because execution of one timer failed. We can't
   13084             :   // propagate the error to anyone who cares about it from this
   13085             :   // point anyway, and the script context should have already reported
   13086             :   // the script error in the usual way - so we just drop it.
   13087             : 
   13088             :   // Since we might be processing more timeouts, go ahead and flush the promise
   13089             :   // queue now before we do that.  We need to do that while we're still in our
   13090             :   // "running JS is safe" state (e.g. mRunningTimeout is set, timeout->mRunning
   13091             :   // is false).
   13092           0 :   Promise::PerformMicroTaskCheckpoint();
   13093             : 
   13094           0 :   if (trackNestingLevel) {
   13095             :     TimeoutManager::SetNestingLevel(nestingLevel);
   13096             :   }

   13098           0 :   mTimeoutManager->EndRunningTimeout(last_running_timeout);
   13099           0 :   timeout->mRunning = false;
   13100             : 
   13101           0 :   return timeout->mCleared;
   13102             : }

   13481             : void
   13482           0 : nsGlobalWindow::AddGamepad(uint32_t aIndex, Gamepad* aGamepad)
   13483             : {
   13484             :   MOZ_ASSERT(IsInnerWindow());
   13485             :   // Create the index we will present to content based on which indices are
   13486             :   // already taken, as required by the spec.
   13487             :   // https://w3c.github.io/gamepad/gamepad.html#widl-Gamepad-index
   13488           0 :   int index = 0;

   13490           0 :     ++index;
   13491             :   }

   13609             : void
   13610           0 : nsGlobalWindow::DispatchVRDisplayActivate(uint32_t aDisplayID,
   13611             :                                           mozilla::dom::VRDisplayEventReason aReason)
   13612             : {
   13613             :   // Search for the display identified with aDisplayID and fire the
   13614             :   // event if found.
   13615           0 :   for (auto display : mVRDisplays) {
   13616           0 :     if (display->DisplayId() == aDisplayID) {
   13617           0 :       if (aReason != VRDisplayEventReason::Navigation &&
   13618           0 :           display->IsAnyPresenting()) {
   13619             :         // We only want to trigger this event if nobody is presenting to the
   13620             :         // display already or when a page is loaded by navigating away
   13621             :         // from a page with an active VR Presentation.
   13622           0 :         continue;
   13623             :       }
   13624             : 
   13625           0 :       VRDisplayEventInit init;
   13626           0 :       init.mBubbles = false;
   13627           0 :       init.mCancelable = false;
   13628           0 :       init.mDisplay = display;
   13629             :       init.mReason.Construct(aReason);
   13630             : 
   13631             :       RefPtr<VRDisplayEvent> event =
   13632             :         VRDisplayEvent::Constructor(this,
   13633             :                                     NS_LITERAL_STRING("vrdisplayactivate"),
   13634           0 :                                     init);
   13635             :       // vrdisplayactivate is a trusted event, allowing VRDisplay.requestPresent
   13636             :       // to be used in response to link traversal, user request (chrome UX), and
   13637             :       // HMD mounting detection sensors.
   13638           0 :       event->SetTrusted(true);
   13639             :       bool defaultActionEnabled;
   13640             :       // VRDisplay.requestPresent normally requires a user gesture; however, an
   13641             :       // exception is made to allow it to be called in response to vrdisplayactivate
   13642             :       // during VR link traversal.
   13643           0 :       display->StartHandlingVRNavigationEvent();
   13644           0 :       Unused << DispatchEvent(event, &defaultActionEnabled);
   13645           0 :       display->StopHandlingVRNavigationEvent();
   13646             :       // Once we dispatch the event, we must not access any members as an event
   13647             :       // listener can do anything, including closing windows.
   13648           0 :       return;
   13649             :     }
   13650           0 :   }
   13651             : }
   13652             :

   13830             :     case nsSizeMode_Maximized:
   13831             :       return nsIDOMChromeWindow::STATE_MAXIMIZED;
   13832             :     case nsSizeMode_Fullscreen:
   13833             :       return nsIDOMChromeWindow::STATE_FULLSCREEN;
   13834             :     case nsSizeMode_Normal:
   13835             :       return nsIDOMChromeWindow::STATE_NORMAL;
   13836             :     default:
   13837             :       NS_WARNING("Illegal window state for this chrome window");
   13838             :       break;
   13839             :   }
   13840             : 
   13841             :   return nsIDOMChromeWindow::STATE_NORMAL;
   13842             : }

   13964             : void
   13965           0 : nsGlobalWindow::BeginWindowMove(Event& aMouseDownEvent, Element* aPanel,
   13966             :                                 ErrorResult& aError)
   13967             : {
   13968             :   MOZ_ASSERT(IsInnerWindow());
   13969             : 
   13970             :   nsCOMPtr<nsIWidget> widget;
   13971             : 
   13972             :   // if a panel was supplied, use its widget instead.
   13973             : #ifdef MOZ_XUL
   13974           0 :   if (aPanel) {
   13975           0 :     nsIFrame* frame = aPanel->GetPrimaryFrame();
   13976           0 :     if (!frame || frame->GetType() != nsGkAtoms::menuPopupFrame) {
   13977             :       return;
   13978             :     }
   13979             : 
   13980           0 :     widget = (static_cast<nsMenuPopupFrame*>(frame))->GetWidget();
   13981             :   }
   13982             :   else {
   13983             : #endif
   13984           0 :     widget = GetMainWidget();
   13985             : #ifdef MOZ_XUL
   13986             :   }
   13987             : #endif
   13988             : 
   13989           0 :   if (!widget) {
   13990             :     return;
   13991             :   }
   13992             : 
   13993             :   WidgetMouseEvent* mouseEvent =
   13994           0 :     aMouseDownEvent.WidgetEventPtr()->AsMouseEvent();
   13995           0 :   if (!mouseEvent || mouseEvent->mClass != eMouseEventClass) {
   13996           0 :     aError.Throw(NS_ERROR_FAILURE);
   13997             :     return;
   13998             :   }
   13999             : 
   14000           0 :   aError = widget->BeginMoveDrag(mouseEvent);
   14001             : }

   14016             : 
   14017             : //Note: This call will lock the cursor, it will not change as it moves.
   14018             : //To unlock, the cursor must be set back to CURSOR_AUTO.

   14777           0 :         do_GetService("@mozilla.org/gfx/screenmanager;1"));

   14933             : mozilla::dom::TabGroup*
   14934           0 : nsGlobalWindow::TabGroupOuter()
   14935             : {
   14936           0 :   MOZ_RELEASE_ASSERT(IsOuterWindow());
   14937             : 
   14938             :   // Outer windows lazily join TabGroups when requested. This is usually done
   14939             :   // because a document is getting its NodePrincipal, and asking for the
   14940             :   // TabGroup to determine its DocGroup.
   14941           0 :   if (!mTabGroup) {
   14942             :     // Get mOpener ourselves, instead of relying on GetOpenerWindowOuter,
   14943             :     // because that way we dodge the LegacyIsCallerChromeOrNativeCode() call
   14944             :     // which we want to return false.
   14945           0 :     nsCOMPtr<nsPIDOMWindowOuter> piOpener = do_QueryReferent(mOpener);
   14946           0 :     nsPIDOMWindowOuter* opener = GetSanitizedOpener(piOpener);
   14947           0 :     nsPIDOMWindowOuter* parent = GetScriptableParentOrNull();
   14948             :     MOZ_ASSERT(!parent || !opener, "Only one of parent and opener may be provided");
   14949             : 
   14950           0 :     mozilla::dom::TabGroup* toJoin = nullptr;
   14951           0 :     if (GetDocShell()->ItemType() == nsIDocShellTreeItem::typeChrome) {
   14952           0 :       toJoin = TabGroup::GetChromeTabGroup();
   14953           0 :     } else if (opener) {
   14954           0 :       toJoin = opener->TabGroup();
   14955           0 :     } else if (parent) {
   14956           0 :       toJoin = parent->TabGroup();
   14957             :     } else {
   14958           0 :       toJoin = TabGroup::GetFromWindow(AsOuter());
   14959             :     }
   14960             : 
   14961             : #ifdef DEBUG
   14962             :     // Make sure that, if we have a tab group from the actor, it matches the one
   14963             :     // we're planning to join.
   14964             :     mozilla::dom::TabGroup* testGroup = TabGroup::GetFromWindow(AsOuter());
   14965             :     MOZ_ASSERT_IF(testGroup, testGroup == toJoin);
   14966             : #endif
   14967             : 
   14968           0 :     mTabGroup = mozilla::dom::TabGroup::Join(AsOuter(), toJoin);
   14969             :   }
   14970             :   MOZ_ASSERT(mTabGroup);
   14971             : 
   14972             : #ifdef DEBUG
   14973             :   // Ensure that we don't recurse forever
   14974             :   if (!mIsValidatingTabGroup) {
   14975             :     mIsValidatingTabGroup = true;
   14976             :     // We only need to do this check if we aren't in the chrome tab group
   14977             :     if (mIsChrome) {
   14978             :       MOZ_ASSERT(mTabGroup == TabGroup::GetChromeTabGroup());
   14979             :     } else {
   14980             :       // Sanity check that our tabgroup matches our opener or parent.
   14981             :       RefPtr<nsPIDOMWindowOuter> parent = GetScriptableParentOrNull();
   14982             :       MOZ_ASSERT_IF(parent, parent->TabGroup() == mTabGroup);
   14983             :       nsCOMPtr<nsPIDOMWindowOuter> piOpener = do_QueryReferent(mOpener);
   14984             :       nsPIDOMWindowOuter* opener = GetSanitizedOpener(piOpener);
   14985             :       MOZ_ASSERT_IF(opener && Cast(opener) != this, opener->TabGroup() == mTabGroup);
   14986             :     }

   14988             :   }

   14990             : 
   14991           0 :   return mTabGroup;

   14997           0 :   MOZ_RELEASE_ASSERT(IsInnerWindow());
   14998             : 
   14999             :   // If we don't have a TabGroup yet, try to get it from the outer window and
   15000             :   // cache it.
   15001           0 :   if (!mTabGroup) {
   15002           0 :     nsGlobalWindow* outer = GetOuterWindowInternal();
   15003             :     // This will never be called without either an outer window, or a cached tab group.
   15004             :     // This is because of the following:
   15005             :     // * This method is only called on inner windows
   15006             :     // * This method is called as a document is attached to it's script global
   15007             :     //   by the document
   15008             :     // * Inner windows are created in nsGlobalWindow::SetNewDocument, which
   15009             :     //   immediately sets a document, which will call this method, causing
   15010             :     //   the TabGroup to be cached.
   15011           0 :     MOZ_RELEASE_ASSERT(outer, "Inner window without outer window has no cached tab group!");
